Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello

Class OthelloRandomProbability

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello.OthelloController
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello.OthelloControllerRandomVSRandom
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello.OthelloRandomProbability
public class OthelloRandomProbability extends OthelloControllerRandomVSRandom
The OthelloRandomProbability class simulates probabilities of two computers, P1 and P2, playing Othello with random strategies. It calculates the probability of each player winning, distributes the data and applies the bootstrap resampling method to estimate the likelihood of each player winning. This includes the p1 and p2 distributed dataset, and the p1 and p2 bootstrap dataset.

  • Method Details

    • generateProbability

      public float[] generateProbability(int numGames)
      Generate an array of probabilities of P1 and P2 winning, by simulating numGames number of Othello games between two computers, each with a random strategy.
      Parameters:
      numGames - the number of games to simulate
      Returns:
      an array of two floats, the first element is the probability of P1 winning, and the second element is the probability of P2 winning.

    • simulateDistribution

      public void simulateDistribution(int numGames, int numSamples)
      Simulate a distribution of probabilities of P1 and P2 winning by generating numSamples number of arrays, each of which contains the probability of P1 and P2 winning by simulating numGames number of games.
      Parameters:
      numGames - the number of games to simulate
      numSamples - the number of samples to generate

    • simulateDistribution

      public void simulateDistribution()
      Overloaded method to simulate a distribution of probabilities of P1 and P2 winning by simulating 1000 games 20 times.

    • bootstrapResampleDataset

      public void bootstrapResampleDataset(int numSamples)
      Resample the dataset by randomly selecting elements from the current distributed dataset of p1 and p2 winning probabilities, and creating a new dataset of P1 and P2 winning probabilities.
      Parameters:
      numSamples - the number of samples in the new dataset

    • simulateBootstrap

      public void simulateBootstrap(int numgames, int numSamples)
      Prints the simulation of a Bootstrap distribution of probabilities of P1 and P2 winning by simulating numGames number of games, and then resample the dataset with a size of numSamples.
      Parameters:
      numSamples - the number of samples in the new dataset
      numGames - the number of games to simulate

    • simulateBootstrap

      public void simulateBootstrap()
      Overloaded method to prints the simulation of a Bootstrap distribution of probabilities of P1 and P2 winning by simulating 10000 games, and then resample the dataset with a size of 20.

    • average

      public float average(float[] dataset)
      Calculate the average of a given dataset.
      Parameters:
      dataset - the dataset to calculate the average of
      Returns:
      the average of the dataset

    • toString

      public String toString(float[] dataset)
      Parameters:
      dataset - the dataset to convert to a string
      Returns:

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Run this to test the OthelloRandomProbability class. The class simulates a bootstrap distribution of probabilities of P1 and P2 winning by simulating 10000 games, and then resample the dataset with a size of 20.
